intro: Zaluzianskya selaginoides, commonly known as the silver leaf germander, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It is a low-growing perennial shrub with succulent, silver-gray leaves that are covered in fine hairs. The plant produces small, tubular flowers that range in color from white to pink, typically blooming in spring. It is well adapted to arid environments and thrives in full sun with minimal water. Zaluzianskya selaginoides is often used in rock gardens and xeriscaping due to its drought tolerance and ornamental appeal.
